session_metadata.session_purpose: Repository review, restructuring, and ADR implementation

cognitive_context.problem_understanding: Wedding planning repository was created by previous AI with organized subdirectory structure (docs/, research/, guests/, etc.). User requested flattening all files to root directory for simplicity. Repository was never pushed to GitHub. All file path references in documentation broken after flattening.
attempted_solutions: Cloned empty GitHub repository to verify remote state
Flattened all subdirectories by moving files to root and removing empty folders
Systematically updated all file path references across documentation files
Implemented ADR (Architecture Decision Records) infrastructure per user requirements
Created comprehensive ADR documenting the directory structure decision with rationale and trade-offs
key_insights: Previous AI did excellent work - comprehensive planning system with Arizona-specific venue research
Subdirectory structure was actually better for organization, but user preference prioritized simplicity
All wedding planning files are high-quality and ready to use
Venue research is particularly strong - detailed analysis of 4 specific venues with cost comparisons
Directory flattening required updating references in 6 files: README.md, QUICK-START.md, COMPREHENSIVE-VENUE-ANALYSIS.md, VENUE-RESEARCH-TLDR.md, vendor-requirements.md
ADR system adds professional project management infrastructure
dead_ends: None - all tasks completed successfully without blocking issues
assumptions: User wants complete flattening with NO subdirectories except for infrastructure (docs/decisions/, docs/handoffs/, state/, outputs/)
User is comfortable with git operations and GitHub workflow
October 2026 wedding date is approximately 12 months away, making this the critical venue booking phase
User prefers simplicity over organization for wedding planning files
uncertainties: Apollo.io context mentioned by user but no content found in repository - may have been error or unrelated reference
Whether user will find flat structure sustainable as more vendor comparisons and documents are created
If Jordyn (fiancÃ©e) will find the system intuitive
Optimal balance between flat structure simplicity and organization as project grows

modified_files.README.md: Updated Quick Links section with corrected file paths, rewrote Repository Structure section to reflect flat structure, added all new files to Quick Links

breaking_changes: All file paths changed from subdirectory structure to flat root structure - requires all users to update any external references or bookmarks
technical_debt_added: Flat structure will become unwieldy as more vendor comparisons and documents are added - may need reorganization in 3-6 months
Large image files (7.6MB PNG files) committed to git - should consider Git LFS in future
No vendor folder structure means vendor comparisons will clutter root directory

external_dependencies: Local git repository at: C:\Projects\Zimmerman-Ginsberg Wedding 2026

decision_log.decision: Flatten all subdirectories to root directory
decision_log.rationale: User explicitly requested flat structure for simplicity. Non-technical users (Ryan and Jordyn) benefit from all files in one location without folder navigation complexity.
alternatives: Hybrid approach with only 2-3 top-level folders
Use naming prefixes instead of folders for logical grouping

decision_log.rationale: User requested ADR system per professional project management standards. Provides documentation trail for all major decisions with rationale and trade-offs.
alternatives: Skip formal ADR process and just document in decision-log.md
Use simpler decision tracking without infrastructure folders

decision_log.decision: Preserve docs/decisions/, docs/handoffs/, state/, outputs/ infrastructure folders
decision_log.rationale: Infrastructure folders for ADRs, handoffs, and session state don't conflict with wedding planning files. These support project management and continuity between sessions.
alternatives: Flatten these too and put everything in root
Use different naming convention to distinguish infrastructure

immediate_tasks: Create comprehensive progress report following Workflow 1 template
Create handoff document following Workflow 2 template
Commit all changes with comprehensive git message
investigation_needed: Clarify Apollo.io context mentioned by user
Determine if additional vendor comparison templates needed
Assess if flat structure remains usable after 10-20 more files are added
